basis.services_title: Your personal, private and independent services.
basis.connect_to_existing: I already have a SelfPrivacy server!
basis.please_connect: Please connect your server, domain and DNS provider to dive in!
basis.feature_unsupported_on_api_version: This feature is only supported on server version {versionConstraint}. Your server is on version {currentVersion}.
basis.server_is_outdated: This SelfPrivacy version requires API version {versionConstraint}, but your server is on version {currentVersion}. Some features won't work and errors might occur. Please upgrade your server.

about_application_page.title: About & support
about_application_page.bug_report_subtitle: Due to spam, manual account confirmation is required. Contact us in the support chat to activate your account.

application_settings.title: Application settings
application_settings.system_theme_mode_description: Use light or dark theme depending on system settings
application_settings.reset_config_description: Resets API keys and root user.

ssh.title: SSH keys
ssh.delete_confirm_question: Are you sure you want to delete SSH key?
ssh.root_subtitle: Owners of these keys get full access to the server and can do anything on it. Only add your own keys to the server.
ssh.input_label: Public ED25519, ECDSA or RSA key
ssh.ssh_disabled_warning: SSH is disabled. You can enable it in the server settings.

onboarding.page1_title: Digital independence, available to all of us
onboarding.page1_text: Mail, VPN, Messenger, social network and much more on your private server, under your control.
onboarding.page2_title: SelfPrivacy is not a cloud, it's Your personal datacenter
onboarding.page2_text: SelfPrivacy only works with providers that you choose. If you do not have required accounts in those, we'll help you to create them.
onboarding.page2_server_provider_text: A server provider maintains your server in its own data center. SelfPrivacy will automatically connect to the provider and setup all necessary things.
onboarding.page2_dns_provider_text: You need a domain to have a place in the Internet. And you also need a reliable DNS provider to have the domain pointed to your server. We will suggest you pick a supported DNS provider to automatically setup networking.
onboarding.page2_backup_provider_text: What if something happens to your server? Imagine a hacker attack, an accidental data deletion or denial of service? Your data will be kept safe in your provider of backups. They will be securely encrypted and anytime accessible to restore your server with.

resource_chart.cpu_chart_screen_reader_explanation: This chart shows the CPU usage in last {period}. The last value is at {lastValue}%. The average usage is at {averageUsage}%. The maximal usage is at {maxUsage}% at {maxUsageTime}.

disk_chart_screen_reader_explanation.beginning: This chart shows the disk usage in last {period}.
disk_chart_screen_reader_explanation.disk: For {disk} the consumption went from {beginningValue}% to {endValue}%.

resource_chart.network_chart_screen_reader_explanation: This chart shows the network usage in last {period}. The last value is at {lastValueIn} inbound and {lastValueOut} outbound. The average usage is at {averageUsageIn} inbound and {averageUsageOut} outbound. The maximal inbound usage is at {maxUsageIn} at {maxUsageTimeIn} and maximal outbound {maxUsageOut} at {maxUsageTimeOut} out.
resource_chart.memory_chart_screen_reader_explanation: This chart shows the memory usage in last {period}. The last value is at {lastValue}%. The average usage is at {averageUsage}%. The maximal usage is at {maxUsage}% at {maxUsageTime}.
resource_chart.swap_chart_screen_reader_explanation: This chart shows the swap memory usage in last {period}. The last value is at {lastValue}%. The average usage is at {averageUsage}%. The maximal usage is at {maxUsage}% at {maxUsageTime}.
resource_chart.unsupported: You can't view resource usage charts without the server provider token.
resource_chart.failed_to_load_memory_metrics: Couldn't load memory usage data. This might be a connection issue, or there is not enough data yet.

server.allow_autoupgrade_hint: Allow automatic packages upgrades on server
server.reboot_after_upgrade_hint: Reboot without prompt after applying changes on server
server.enable_ssh_hint: Allow SSH access to the server
server.timezone_search_bar: Timezone name or time shift value

domain.error_subtitle: Tap here to fix them. This will also remove custom records.
domain.services_subtitle: Type “A” records required for each service.
domain.email_subtitle: Records necessary for secure email exchange.
domain.other_subtitle: Other records needed for the work of the SelfPrivacy

backup.description: Will save your day in case of incident: hackers attack, server deletion, etc.
backup.reupload_key_subtitle: Will instruct the server to initialize backup storage again. Use if something is broken.
backup.restore_alert: You are about to restore from backup created on {}. All current data will be lost. Are you sure?
backup.refetch_backups_subtitle: Invalidate cache and refetch data from your storage provider. May cause additional charges.
backup.refetching_list: In a few minutes list will be updated
backup.service_busy: Another backup operation is in progress
backup.backups_encryption_key_subtitle: Keep it in a safe place
backup.backups_encryption_key_description: This key is used to encrypt your backups. If you lose it, you will not be able to restore your backups. Keep it in a safe place, as it will be useful if you ever need to restore from backups manually.
backup.backups_encryption_key_not_found: Encryption key not found yet, please try again later.
backup.forget_snapshot_alert: You are about to delete this snapshot. Are you sure? This action usually cannot be undone.
backup.snapshot_modal_download_verify_option_de: Less risk, but more free space needed. Downloads entire snapshot to the temporary storage, verifies it and then replaces the current data.
backup.snapshot_modal_inplace_option_descriptio: Less free space needed, but more risk. Replaces current data with the snapshot data during the download.
backup.snapshot_modal_service_not_found: This is a snapshot of a service you don't have on your server anymore. Usually this shouldn't happen, and we cannot do the automatic restore. You can still download the snapshot and restore it manually. Contact SelfPrivacy support if you need help.
backup.restore_started: Restore started, check the jobs list for the current status

snapshot_reasons.pre_restore: Created as a precaution before risky restore

backup.quotas_only_applied_to_autobackups: These settings are only applied to automatic backups. Manual backups won't get deleted.

quota_titles.last: How many latest backups to keep
quota_titles.daily: How many daily backups to keep
quota_titles.weekly: How many weekly backups to keep
quota_titles.monthly: How many monthly backups to keep
quota_titles.yearly: How many yearly backups to keep

quota_subtitles.no_effect: This rule has no effect because another rule will keep more backups

last.one: Last {} backup will be kept regardless of its age
last.two: Last {} backups will be kept regardless of their age
last.few: Last {} backups will be kept regardless of their age
last.many: Last {} backups will be kept regardless of their age
last.other: Last {} backups will be kept regardless of their age

daily.one: Last {} daily backup will be kept
daily.two: Last {} daily backups will be kept
daily.few: Last {} daily backups will be kept
daily.many: Last {} daily backups will be kept
daily.other: Last {} daily backups will be kept

quota_subtitles.daily_infinite: All daily backups will be kept

weekly.one: Last {} weekly backup will be kept
weekly.two: Last {} weekly backups will be kept
weekly.few: Last {} weekly backups will be kept
weekly.many: Last {} weekly backups will be kept
weekly.other: Last {} weekly backups will be kept

quota_subtitles.weekly_infinite: All weekly backups will be kept

monthly.one: Last {} monthly backup will be kept
monthly.two: Last {} monthly backups will be kept
monthly.few: Last {} monthly backups will be kept
monthly.many: Last {} monthly backups will be kept
monthly.other: Last {} monthly backups will be kept

quota_subtitles.monthly_infinite: All monthly backups will be kept

yearly.one: Last {} yearly backup will be kept
yearly.two: Last {} yearly backups will be kept
yearly.few: Last {} yearly backups will be kept
yearly.many: Last {} yearly backups will be kept
yearly.other: Last {} yearly backups will be kept

quota_subtitles.yearly_infinite: All yearly backups will be kept

storage.extending_volume_description: Resizing volume will allow you to store more data on your server without extending the server itself. Volume can only be extended: shrinking is not possible.
storage.extending_volume_price_info: Price includes VAT and is estimated from pricing data provided by your server provider. Server will be rebooted after resizing.
storage.data_migration_notice: During migration all services will be turned off.

not_ready_card.in_menu: Server is not set up yet. Please finish setup using setup wizard for further work.

service_page.invalid_value_detected: Invalid value detected. Please change it.
service_page.wait_for_jobs: Server is busy with other jobs. Please wait until they are finished.

support_levels.normal_description: This SelfPrivacy module is supported by the SelfPrivacy team as usual. If you encounter any issues with this module, feel free to contact us.
support_levels.experimental_description: This SelfPrivacy module is experimental. It might not work as intended yet.
support_levels.deprecated_description: This SelfPrivacy module is deprecated. We no longer provide support for this service and it might not work as intended.
support_levels.community_description: This SelfPrivacy module is supported by the community. SelfPrivacy team might not be able to provide support.
support_levels.unknown_description: Support level for this SelfPrivacy module is unknown. Maybe, it is your own module and you forgot to set the support level field?
support_levels.system_description: This SelfPrivacy module is an essential system module. It is required for SelfPrivacy to work properly. If you encounter any issues with this module, please contact us.

services_catalog.title: Services catalog
services_catalog.empty_subtitle: You've installed everything. Check back later.

mail.login_info: Your users can visit Self-service portal at a link above to get a password with connection instructions.

password_manager.login_info: You will have to create an account on the website.

cloud.login_info: Login is admin, password is the same as with your main user. Create new accounts in Nextcloud interface.

social_network.login_info: You will have to create an account on the website.

git.login_info: You will have to create an account on the website. First user will become an admin.

users.groups_only_email_subtitle: This user will only have access to Email by default. You can grant other permissions by setting explicit permissions.
users.groups_full_user_subtitle: This user will have access to every service by default. You can grant administrator privileges to specific services by setting explicit permissions.
users.groups_full_user_short_description: Has access to all services by default
users.groups_admin_subtitle: This user will have access to every service by default and will have administrator privileges to every service where it is possible.
users.groups_admin_short_description: Has administrator privileges to all services by default
users.explicit_permissions_subtitle: This user will have these permissions regardless of the group selected above
users.no_groups_subtitle: Looks like you don't have any services with SSO enabled yet
users.could_not_fetch_description: Please check your internet connection and try again
users.user_modify_protected: This user is protected and cannot be modified
users.user_delete_protected: This user is protected and cannot be deleted
users.username_rule: Username must contain only lowercase latin letters, digits and underscores, should not start with a digit
users.no_ssh_notice: Only email and SSH accounts are created for this user. Single Sign On for all services is coming soon.
users.user_already_exists: A user with this username already exists
users.password_reset_link_description: Send this link to {username} so they can set a passkey or a password for their account. The link is valid for 1 hour.

initializing.select_provider: Pick any provider from the following list, they all support SelfPrivacy
initializing.select_provider_notice: By 'Relatively small' we mean a machine with 2 cores of CPU and 2 gigabytes of RAM.
initializing.select_provider_countries_text_do: USA, Netherlands, Singapore, UK, Germany, Canada, India, Australia
initializing.select_provider_price_text_hetzner: €8 per month for a relatively small server and 50GB of disk storage
initializing.select_provider_price_text_do: $17 per month for a relatively small server and 50GB of disk storage
initializing.select_provider_email_notice: E-mail hosting won't be available for new clients. Nevertheless it will be unlocked as soon as you complete your first payment.
initializing.server_provider_email_unavailable: E-mail won't work with this provider.
initializing.connect_to_server_provider_text: With API token SelfPrivacy will be able to rent a machine and setup your server on it
initializing.choose_location_type: Where do you want to order your server?
initializing.choose_location_type_text: Different locations provide different server configurations, prices and connection speed.
initializing.locations_not_found_text: There are no available servers to rent
initializing.no_locations_found: No available locations found, make sure your account is accessible
initializing.choose_server_type: What type of server do you need?
initializing.choose_server_type_text: Different resource capabilities support different services. Don't worry, you can expand your server anytime
initializing.choose_server_type_notice: The important things to look at are the CPU and RAM. The data of your services will be stored on a mounted volume which is easily expandable and gets paid for separately.
initializing.select_dns: Now let's select a DNS provider
initializing.use_this_domain_text: The token you provided gives access to the following domain
initializing.multiple_domains_found_text: The token you provided gives access to the following domains. Please select the one you want to use. For the security of your other domains, you should restrict this token's access to only the domain you want to use with SelfPrivacy.
initializing.no_connected_domains: No connected domains at the moment
initializing.server_rebooted: Server rebooted. Waiting for the last verification…
initializing.server_started: Server started. It will be validated and rebooted now…
initializing.server_created: Server created. DNS checks and server boot in progress…
initializing.domain_critical_error: We can't reach this domain! Tap to read more…
initializing.one_more_restart: One more restart to apply your security certificates.
initializing.checks:
Checks have been completed 
{done} out of {total}

recovering.domain_recovery_description: Enter a server domain you want to get access for:
recovering.domain_recover_error: Server with such domain was not found
recovering.method_select_other_device: I have access on another device
recovering.method_select_nothing: I don't have any of that
recovering.method_device_description: Open the application on another device, then go to the devices page. Press "Add device" to receive your token.
recovering.fallback_select_description: What exactly do you have? Pick the first available option:
recovering.fallback_select_token_copy: Copy of auth token from other version of the application.
recovering.fallback_select_root_ssh: Root SSH access to the server.
recovering.fallback_select_provider_console: Access to the server console of my provider.
recovering.authorization_failed: Couldn't log in with this key
recovering.provider_connected_description: Enter your token with access to {}:
recovering.server_provider_unknown_description: Your server provider is not recognized. You can continue without entering its API token.
recovering.confirm_server_description: Found your server! Confirm it is the right one:
recovering.choose_server_description: We couldn't figure out which server your are trying to connect to.
recovering.no_servers: There is no available servers on your account.
recovering.domain_not_available_on_token: Selected domain is not available on this token.
recovering.modal_confirmation_description: If you connect to a wrong server you may lose all your data.
recovering.modal_confirmation_dns_invalid: Reverse DNS points to another domain
recovering.modal_confirmation_ip_valid: IP address is the same as in DNS record
recovering.modal_confirmation_ip_invalid: IP address is not the same as in DNS record

main_screen.description: These devices have full access to the server via SelfPrivacy app.
main_screen.tip: Press on the device to revoke access.

add_new_device_screen.description: Enter the key on the device you want to authorize:
add_new_device_screen.tip: The key is valid for 10 minutes.

revoke_device_alert.description: The device {} will no longer have access to the server.

refresh_token_alert.description: A new token will be generated for this device to connect to the server.
refresh_token_alert.failed_to_refresh_token: Couldn't refresh the token. Please try again.

recovery_key.key_main_description: Is needed for SelfPrivacy authorization when all your other authorized devices aren't available.
recovery_key.key_invalid: Your key is no longer valid
recovery_key.key_receiving_description: Write down this key and put to a safe place. It is used to restore full access to your server:
recovery_key.key_receiving_info: The key will never ever be shown again, but you will be able to replace it with another one.

modals.unexpected_error: Unexpected error during placement from the provider side.
modals.destroy_server: Destroy the server and create a new one?

jobs.title: Jobs list
jobs.job_postponed: Job added, but you will be able to launch it after current jobs are finished
jobs.reboot_failed: Couldn't reboot the server. Check the app logs.
jobs.config_pull_failed: Failed to pull configuration upgrade. Started software upgrade anyways.

validations.invalid_format_ssh: Must follow the SSH key format
validations.length_longer: Length is [], should be shorter than or equal to {}

developer_settings.title: Developer settings
developer_settings.subtitle: These settings are for debugging only. Don't change them unless you know what you're doing.
developer_settings.use_staging_acme_description: Applies when setting up a new server.
developer_settings.ignore_tls_description: App will not verify TLS certificates when connecting to the server.
developer_settings.allow_ssh_key_at_setup: Allow setting a root SSH key during setup
developer_settings.allow_ssh_key_at_setup_description: A button to add a key will appear on the confirmation screen.
developer_settings.root_ssh_key_added: Root SSH key set and will be applied
developer_settings.reset_onboarding_description: Reset onboarding switch to show onboarding screen again

tokens.title: Provider tokens
tokens.description: These tokens are stored on this device and are used to connect SelfPrivacy to your server provider, DNS provider, and backup storage provider.
tokens.no_access: Has no access to associated resources
tokens.tap_to_add_token: Tap here to add a token
tokens.server_provider_unknown_description: Your server provider is not supported by this app version.

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.configuration_switch_logs_description: View errors occurred while switching to the new configuration.
